title.narrative: DMDP 2019 – Promoting Economic Growth and Nutrition through Fruit Processing in Ethiopia

description.narrative: High-quality jobs and income opportunities created in production, processing, distribution, and sales of dried fruit products; income boosted; and at-risk populations have access to safe, nutritious and affordable snacks.

High-quality jobs and income opportunities created in production, processing, distribution, and sales of dried fruit products; income boosted; and at-risk populations have access to safe, nutritious and affordable snacks. This project is implemented by the partnership consortium led by GAIN and Arla Food Ingredients, with Addis Ababa University, Africa Juice Tibilia, Confederation of Danish industry, Raya Horti Farm, Selam Tsehay Roschli Industrial & Agricultural Engineering and Theday Agro Industry. The project aims to unleash the potential of Ethiopia’s papaya value chain by developing, testing and demonstrating a model for a new value chain for fruit processing. The project will create decent jobs and income generating opportunities for smallholder farmers, skilled and semi-skilled workers in processing, distribution and retail. This will be achieved by developing sustainable business models that include environmentally-friendly processing techniques. This project will help to reduce post-harvest losses and produce an innovative, high value-add, nutritious and affordable snack, thereby contributing to healthier, more diverse diets. Curricula for vocational training of skilled and semi-skilled workers will be developed and made available through training of trainers at public and private institutions. The Danida Market Development Partnerships programme (DMDP) is designed to support commercially oriented partnerships for sustainable market development in developing countries. In addition to reporting on individually determined outputs and outcomes, all DMDP projects report on five key programme indicators. These five indicators are the same for the whole project portfolio, enabling strategic and programme level monitoring, and aggregation of results.
